data.title: 59 Notable Alumni of the Chalmers University of Technology
data.meta_description: Below is the list of 59 notable alumni from the Chalmers University of Technology sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.
data.meta_site_name: EduRank.org - Discover university rankings by location
data.text:
59 Notable alumni of

Chalmers University of Technology

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

The Chalmers University of Technology is 1174th in the world, 413th in Europe, and 11th in Sweden by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 59 notable alumni from the Chalmers University of Technology sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.

PewDiePie

Born in

Sweden

Years

1989-.. (age 35)

Occupations

gamerwriterYouTuberInternet celebritytelevision producer

Biography

Felix Arvid Ulf Kjellberg, better known as PewDiePie, is a Swedish YouTuber known for his comedic videos. Kjellberg's popularity on YouTube and extensive media coverage has made him one of the most noted online personalities and content creators. He has been portrayed in the media as a figurehead for YouTube, especially in the genre of gaming.

Linn Berggren

Born in

Sweden

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Occupations

songwritersinger

Biography

Malin Sofia Katarina Berggren is a Swedish singer-songwriter, best known as a former member of the pop music band Ace of Base. Having been interested and involved in music since her childhood, she formed the band in 1987, along with her sister Jenny, her brother Jonas and their friend Ulf Ekberg. Before forming Ace of Base, Malin sang in her church's choir. She was born in Gothenburg, Sweden.

Gustaf Dalén

Born in

Sweden

Years

1869-1937 (aged 68)

Occupations

industrialistphysicistentrepreneurchemistbusiness executive

Biography

Nils Gustaf Dalén was a Swedish Nobel laureate and industrialist, engineer, inventor and long-term CEO of the AGA company and inventor of the AGA cooker and the Dalén light. In 1912 he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics for his "invention of automatic regulators for use in conjunction with gas accumulators for illuminating lighthouses and buoys".

Gert Wingårdh

Born in

Sweden

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Occupations

architect

Biography

Gert Wingårdh is a Swedish architect whose company, Wingårdh arkitektkontor, maintains an international practice.

Leif Johansson

Born in

Sweden

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Enrolled in the Chalmers University of Technology

In 1977 graduated with Master of Science in Engineering in mechanical engineering

Occupations

engineerentrepreneur

Biography

Leif Valdemar Johansson is a Swedish businessman. He was President and CEO of the Volvo Group from 1997 to 2011 and Chairman of Ericsson from 2011 until 2017 and is currently Chairman of AstraZeneca plc. In 2012, the Fokus Magazine ranked him as Sweden's 6th most powerful person.

Jan Rippe

Born in

Sweden

Years

1955-.. (age 69)

Occupations

actor

Biography

Jan Torbjörn Rippe is a Swedish actor, singer, and comedian. He is known as a member of the comedic groups Galenskaparna and After Shave. He also had a role in the comedy series Macken.

Ivar Jacobson

Born in

Sweden

Years

1939-.. (age 85)

Occupations

inventorcomputer scientist

Biography

Ivar Hjalmar Jacobson is a Swedish computer scientist and software engineer, known as a major contributor to UML, Objectory, Rational Unified Process (RUP), aspect-oriented software development and Essence.

Sigurd Lewerentz

Born in

Sweden

Years

1885-1975 (aged 90)

Enrolled in the Chalmers University of Technology

Studied in 1908

Occupations

architect

Biography

Sigurd Lewerentz was a Swedish architect.

Sigfrid Edström

Born in

Sweden

Years

1870-1964 (aged 94)

Occupations

athletics competitorengineerpoliticianbusinessperson

Biography

Johannes Sigfrid Edström was a Swedish industrialist, chairman of the Sweden-America Foundation, and 4th President of the International Olympic Committee.

Erik Johansson

Born in

Sweden

Years

1985-.. (age 39)

Occupations

visual artistphotographer

Biography

Erik Johansson is a Swedish-born artist based in Prague who creates surreal images by combining photographic elements and other materials into surreal scenes. He combines images to create what looks like a real photograph, but creates logical inconsistencies to impart an effect of surrealism.

Leif Östling

Born in

Sweden

Years

1945-.. (age 79)

Occupations

businesspersonmechanical engineerinternational forum participant

Biography

Leif Albert Östling is a Swedish chief executive officer and former head of the Scania AB truck company, owned by the German Volkswagen Group. In spring 2016, he was appointed Chairman of the Confederation of Swedish Enterprise, a post he left in advance in November 2017.

Martin Lundstedt

Born in

Sweden

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Occupations

engineerbusiness executiveinternational forum participantbusinessperson

Biography

Martin Lundstedt is a Swedish businessman and has been President and CEO of the Volvo Group since 22 October 2015. He has 25 years experience of development, production and sales within the heavy automotive industry.

Nima Sanandaji

Born in

Iran

Years

1981-.. (age 43)

Occupations

writer

Biography

Nima Sanandaji is a center-right liberal-conservative Iranian-Swedish social and natural researcher. As of 2023, he has above 400 scientific mentions related to economics, social sciences, history, biotechnology, polymer technology, and physical chemistry. He has published over 30 books on innovation, entrepreneurship, women’s career opportunities,crime prevention, preventive social work, the history of enterprise, and the Nordic welfare states.

Ivar Tengbom

Born in

Sweden

Years

1878-1968 (aged 90)

Occupations

architectuniversity teacher

Biography

Ivar Justus Tengbom was a Swedish architect and one of the best-known representatives of the Swedish neo-classical architecture of the 1910s and 1920s.

Bernhard Schmidt

Born in

Estonia

Years

1879-1935 (aged 56)

Occupations

astronomerphysicist

Biography

Bernhard Woldemar Schmidt was an Estonian optician. In 1930 he invented the Schmidt telescope which corrected for the optical errors of spherical aberration, coma, and astigmatism, making possible for the first time the construction of very large, wide-angled reflective cameras of short exposure time for astronomical research.

Caroline Farberger

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Occupations

business executive

Biography

Caroline Farberger is a Swedish business executive currently working as chairwoman, board advisor and board member on several boards. She previously served as the CEO of the Swedish company ICA Insurance, part of the ICA Group, from 2016 to 2022. Formerly having lived as a man, Farberger is known for being the first Swedish top CEO coming out as transgender. She came out at the age of 49.

Torsten Kreuger

Born in

Sweden

Years

1884-1973 (aged 89)

Occupations

financierbusiness executiveengineer

Biography

Torsten Kreuger was a Swedish engineer, industrialist, newspaper owner and banker.

Hjalmar Lundbohm

Born in

Sweden

Years

1855-1926 (aged 71)

Occupations

chemistbusinesspersonart collectorgeologist

Biography

Johan Olof Hjalmar Lundbohm was a Swedish geologist and chemist and the first managing director of LKAB (Luossavaara-Kiirunavaara Aktiebolag) in Kiruna. He made a strong contribution to the design of the new community of Kiruna in Lapland.

Håkan Buskhe

Born in

Sweden

Years

1963-.. (age 61)

Occupations

chief executive officerbusinessperson

Biography

Kurt Ove Håkan Buskhe is a Swedish businessman, better known as the president and CEO of the Swedish aerospace and defence company Saab Group, a role he has been in since September 2010.

Jesper Brodin

Born in

Sweden

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Occupations

chief executive officerbusinesspersoninternational forum participant

Biography

Jesper Brodin is a Swedish business leader and the chief executive officer (CEO) of Ingka Group. During his career at IKEA, Brodin has held a number of different roles including assistant to Ingvar Kamprad, Business Area Manager Kitchen and Dining, as well as managing director for Range & Supply, Inter IKEA Group.

Zbigniew Karkowski

Born in

Poland

Years

1958-2013 (aged 55)

Occupations

composer

Biography

Zbigniew Karkowski was a Polish experimental musician and composer.

Cyrillus Johansson

Born in

Sweden

1884-1959 (aged 75)

architect

Biography

Cyrillus Johansson was a Swedish architect.

Emil Victor Langlet

Born in

Sweden

Years

1824-1898 (aged 74)

Occupations

architect

Biography

Emil Victor Langlet was a Swedish architect. He is most commonly associated with his design for the Norwegian Parliament Building in Oslo, Norway.

Janne Wallenius

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Occupations

physicistnuclear physicist

Biography

Janne Wallenius is a Swedish reactor physicist. He is a professor at the Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden.

Olav Kallenberg

Born in

Sweden

Years

1939-.. (age 85)

Occupations

university teacherstatisticianmathematician

Biography

Olav Kallenberg is a probability theorist known for his work on exchangeable stochastic processes and for his graduate-level textbooks and monographs. Kallenberg is a professor of mathematics at Auburn University in Alabama in the USA.

Peter Nordin

Born in

Sweden

Years

1965-2020 (aged 55)

Occupations

computer scientistbusinesspersonartificial intelligence researcher

Biography

Peter Nordin was a Swedish computer scientist, entrepreneur and author who has contributed to artificial intelligence, automatic programming, machine learning, and evolutionary robotics.

Marcus Wandt

Born in

Sweden

Years

1980-.. (age 44)

Occupations

astronautengineerair force officerfighter pilot

Biography

Marcus Wandt is a Swedish test pilot and member of the 2022 European Space Agency Astronaut Group. In January 2024, he became the third Swedish astronaut to visit space, after Christer Fuglesang and Jessica Meir.

Carl Abraham Pihl

Born in

Norway

Years

1825-1897 (aged 72)

Occupations

engineerrailway engineercivil engineer

Biography

Carl Abraham Pihl was a Norwegian civil engineer and director of the Norwegian State Railways (NSB) from 1865 until his death. Pihl was one of the main architects of the use of narrow-gauge railways in Norway.

Vera Sandberg

Born in

Sweden

Years

1895-1979 (aged 84)

Occupations

engineer

Biography

Vera Helfrid Victoria Sandberg was a Swedish engineer. In 1917, she became Sweden's first female engineer.

Olle Häggström

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Occupations

mathematician

Biography

Olle Häggström is a professor of mathematical statistics at Chalmers University of Technology. Häggström earned his doctorate in 1994 at Chalmers University of Technology with Jeffrey Steif as supervisor. He became an associate professor in the same university in 1997, and professor of mathematical statistics at University of Gothenburg in 2000. In 2002 he was back at Chalmers University of Technology as professor. He mainly researches on probability theory such as Markov chains, percolation theory and other models in statistical mechanics.

Claes Adelsköld

Born in

Sweden

Years

1824-1907 (aged 83)

Occupations

Esperantistwriterrailway engineerarchitectpolitician

Biography

Claes Adolf Adelsköld was a Swedish civil engineer, railway engineer, author, Army officer and member of the upper house of the Parliament of Sweden

Tanel Tammet

Born in

Estonia

Years

1965-.. (age 59)

Occupations

computer scientist

Biography

Tanel Tammet is an Estonian computer scientist, professor, software engineer, and computer programmer. He was also one of the founding members of the Estonian Greens party, and helped found the IT College in Tallinn.

Arvid Wallman

Born in

Sweden

Years

1901-1982 (aged 81)

Enrolled in the Chalmers University of Technology

Graduated with Master of Science in Engineering

Occupations

competitive diver

Biography

Arvid Håkan Herbert Carlsson "Fågeln" Wallman was a Swedish diver. He competed in the plain high diving event at the 1920 and 1924 Summer Olympics and finished in first and eighth place, respectively. After graduating in 1923 from the Chalmers University of Technology he worked as a civil engineer. His granddaughter Susanne Wetteskog also became an Olympic diver.

Helge Zimdal

Born in

Sweden

Years

1903-2001 (aged 98)

Occupations

architectuniversity teacher

Biography

Helge Zimdal, originally Zimdahl was a Swedish architect and professor of architecture at Chalmers University of Technology, known for his many school buildings.

Axel Darvik

Years

1982-.. (age 42)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Axhil Darvik is a Swedish Liberal People's Party politician, member of the Riksdag 2002–2006.

Pam Fredman

Born in

Sweden

Years

1950-.. (age 74)

Occupations

chemical engineer

Biography

Pam Fredman is a Swedish professor of neuroscience and former rector of the University of Gothenburg. From 2016, Fredman is the President of the International Association of Universities

Pernilla Wittung-Stafshede

Born in

Sweden

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Occupations

biochemistuniversity teacherchemist

Biography

Pernilla Wittung-Stafshede is a Swedish biophysical chemist, born in 1968, who is a professor of chemical biology at Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg. In 2019 she was named by International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry as a Distinguished Woman in Chemistry.

Claes-Göran Granqvist

Born in

Sweden

Years

1946-.. (age 78)

Occupations

engineerphysicist

Biography

Claes-Göran Sture Granqvist is a materials physicist and Professor of Solid State Physics at Uppsala University in Sweden. Granqvist is considered a pioneer and expert in photochromic materials and energy-efficient building materials such as glass, paint, and wood.

Anna Dubois

Years

1962-.. (age 62)

Occupations

business theoristmechanical engineeracademiceconomist

Biography

Anna Dubois is a Swedish organizational theorist and professor of technology management and economics at Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg, and director of Chalmers Transport Area of Advance. She is best known for her work with Lars-Erik Gadde on case study research, boundaries of the firm, and managing suppliers interfaces.

Jan Lennartsson

Born in

Sweden

Years

1981-.. (age 43)

Occupations

handball player

Biography

Jan Lennartsson is a Swedish handball player. He started his professional career in 2000 playing for IK Sävehof, Gothenburg. After six seasons with the club, he was contracted by the Danish club AaB Håndbold in 2007. He also has played 125 games and scored 277 goals with the Swedish national handball team.

Hjalmar Kumlien

Born in

Sweden

Years

1837-1897 (aged 60)

Occupations

architect

Biography

Knut Hjalmar Kumlien was a Swedish architect.

Ireland

surveyorengineer

Biography

Abraham 'Abram' Fitzgibbon was an Irish-born railroad engineer and a pioneer for narrow-gauge railways.

Annelie Enochson

Years

1953-.. (age 71)

Occupations

politicianarchitect

Biography

Annelie Enochson is a Swedish Christian Democratic politician and architect. She has been a member of the Riksdag since 2000. In the Riksdag, she has been part of the former Committee on Housing (2000–2002), the Committee on the Labour Market and the Committee on European Union Affairs (2002–2006). She also served as a regular member of the OSCE-delegation between 2002–2006 and is now a deputy member. After the election 2006, Annelie is her party's spokeswoman in traffic-related issues and a regular member of the Committee on the Transport and Communications. She also continues to serve in the OSCE-delegation.

Sweden

1941-.. (age 83)

physicist

Biography

Ingemar Lundström, born 9 May 1941 in Skellefteå, Sweden, is a Swedish professor of applied physics at Linköping University.

physicist

Biography

Lars Ivar Samuelson is a Swedish physicist and professor in nanotechnology and semiconductor electronics at Lund University.

Sweden

Biography

Hugo Hammar was a Swedish businessman.

Sweden

1882-1959 (aged 77)

Biography

Ragnar Svensson was a Swedish sailor who competed in the 1920 Summer Olympics. He was a crew member of the Swedish boat Elsie, which won the silver medal in the 40 m class.

Bengt Ollén

Sweden

Biography

Bengt Ollén is a Swedish choral conductor, music teacher, adjudicator and lecturer. In 1995 Ollén founded Sofia Vokalensemble that has emerged as one of the world's leading amateur choirs.

Ghirmai Efrem is a Swedish-born Eritrean swimmer. He competed in the men's 50 metre freestyle at the 2020 Summer Olympics.

María Guðjónsdóttir is a professor of food science at the University of Iceland.

Sofia Börjesson

Years

1964-.. (age 60)

Occupations

scientist

Biography

Sofia Börjesson is a Swedish Professor (chair) in Technology Management Department at Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg Sweden. Her academic research field evolves around questions of how large, mature organizations change and develop, with focus on the management of innovation work. She works on applying innovation as an organizational transformation and in particular in a context of business model innovation. She applies qualitative methods, often collaborative research methods, cooperating with industrial partners with the intent to create actionable knowledge. She has published her work in journals such as R&D Management, Journal of Change Management, Int. J. Operations and Production Management, Technovation and Creativity and Innovation Management.
